column5: Steel campfire pans. Sometimes they pop up on facebook marketplace if you're wanting to get old ones. There's a few used on ebay right now too, but shipping is crazy. $50-$80 is a decent price for the high side and long handles.
Matfar Bourgeat black carbon steel fry pans, sizes up to 18â diameter Available for reasonable cost at webstaurant.com. Terrific for every day home use as well!
Who makes these pans? They are used throughout Canada for shore lunch. They have a nice long handle and are not cast iron so they are lighter. Or where can you order these?
When I saw the picture I ran to get a plate n fork
cabelas sells them.A few stores in dryden and have seen them at bobbies in vermilion bay
Lodge makes carbon steel pans plus cast iron products.....they are made in the USA. https://www.lodgecastiron.com/produc...llet?sku=CRS12
this should do the trick 20" about 40 bucks

Yes, but I believe made in China. I wanted to buy a cast iron dutch oven, and the only one I found made in North America was Lodge. I would prefer to buy Canadian, but the US is my second choice. Made in China? I don't need it that bad.
Send me a message on the size of the Dutch Oven you want. I'll bring it on the next trip....it may be painted in pink, but that will fade over time PjShorthorn
Thanks, but have already purchased two sizes. It might be addictive, like women with shoes. I think I've maxed out my dutch oven inventory.......but thanks.
Speaking of footwear.....how about a pair of Flamingo slippers for Susanne ???? I have a reputable source .... Or you....????? PjShorthorn
